entry.tran: 诋毁性的;诽谤性的;中伤的
entry.def: A spoken statement that is slanderous is untrue and intended to damage the reputation of the person that it refers to.

example.ex: Herr Kohler wanted an explanation for what he described as 'slanderous' remarks.
example.tran: 赫尔·科勒希望有人能够为那些他称之为“造谣中伤”的言辞作出解释。

means.word_mean: 1. (used of statements) harmful and often untrue; tending to discredit or malign

auth_sentence.content: Really, if you wrote this as fiction it would be hilarious and slanderous!

auth_sentence.content: Within the first two paragraphs, you made more than enough slanderous and defamatory statements about Mr.

sentences.en: A man of moral integrity does not fear any slanderous attack.
